verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Tell your brother Aaron that he must not come just any time into the holy place inside the curtain, in front of the mercy-seat on the special box of the agreement or he will die. For I will show Myself in the cloud over the mercy-seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only this way will Aaron go into the holy place, with a bull for a sin gift and a ram for a burnt gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will put on the holy linen coat. And the linen under-clothing will be next to his body. He will be wearing the linen belt and the linen head-covering. These are holy clothing. He will wash his body in water and then dress himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take from the people of Israel two male goats for a sin gift and one ram for a burnt gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron will give the bull as a sin gift for himself, to pay for the sins of himself and those in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take the two goats and set them before the Lord at the door of the meeting tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron will draw names for the two goats, choosing one for the Lord and the other to be sent away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron will bring the goat that was chosen for the Lord and give it as a sin gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the goat that was chosen to be sent away will be brought alive before the Lord, for the taking away of sin. And it will be sent into the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then Aaron will give the bull as the sin gift for himself, to pay for the sins of himself and those in his house. He will kill the bull as the sin gift for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take a fire pan full of fire from the altar before the Lord, and enough fine, ground, sweet perfume to fill two hands. And he will bring it inside the curtain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will put the special perfume on the fire before the Lord so that the cloud of the special perfume covers the mercy-seat on the special box of the agreement or he will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take some of the bull’s blood and put it with his finger on the east side of the mercy-seat. And with his finger he will put some of the blood seven times in front of the mercy-seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he will kill the goat as the sin gift for the people. He will bring its blood inside the curtain, and do the same with its blood as he did with the bull’s blood. He will put it on the seat and in front of the mercy-seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will make the holy place, and also the meeting tent which is in the center of the camp, clean and pure because all the sins of the people make them unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he goes in to pay for sins in the holy place, no one will be in the meeting tent until he comes out. He will pay for the sins of himself, of those in his house, and of all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will go out to the altar before the Lord and make it clean and pure. He will take some of the bull’s blood and goat’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar on all sides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With his finger he will put some of the blood on the altar seven times so it will be clean. He will set it apart from what is unclean among the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he finishes making the holy place, the meeting tent and the altar free from sin, he will give the live goat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron will lay both his hands on the head of the live goat, and tell of all the sins and wrong-doings of the people of Israel. He will lay them upon the head of the goat and send it away into the desert by the hand of a man ready to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The goat will carry upon itself all their sins to a land where no one lives. Then the man will let the goat go free there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aaron will come into the meeting tent. He will take off the linen clothing he put on when he went into the holy place. And he will leave them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will wash his body with water in a holy place and put on his clothes. Then he will come out and give his burnt gift and the people’s burnt gift, to pay for the sins of himself and the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will burn the fat of the sin gift on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who let the goat carry away the sins will wash his clothes and wash his body with water. Then he may come among the tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bull and the goat for the sin gift, whose blood was brought in to pay for sins in the holy place, will be taken away from the tents. Their skin, their flesh and their waste will be burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever burns them will wash his clothes and wash his body with water. Then he may come among the tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This will be a Law forever for you. On the tenth day of the seventh month, you must get rid of your pride and not do any work, both those who live in the land and those who visit from another land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For on this day your sin will be taken away and you will be clean. You will be made free from all your sins before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to be a special Day of Rest for you, that you may be free from pride. It is a Law forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chosen religious leader who is set apart to work as religious leader in his father’s place will pay for the sin. He will put on the holy linen clothing
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make the holy place, the meeting tent and the altar free from sin. He will make the religious leaders and all the people free from sin also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be a Law forever for you. The people of Israel must be made free from all their sins once a year.” And Moses did what the Lord told him to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to Aaron and his sons and to all the people of Israel, ‘This is what the Lord has told us to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man of the house of Israel kills a bull, lamb or goat, among the tents or away from the tents,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and has not brought it to the door of the meeting tent to give it to the Lord, he will be guilty for that blood, and will not be among God’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The reason is so that the people of Israel may bring their gifts which were killed in the open field to the Lord, to the religious leader at the door of the meeting tent. Then they can be given as peace gifts to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leader will put the blood on the altar of the Lord at the door of the meeting tent. And he will burn the fat for a pleasing smell to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they will no longer give their gifts to the goat-like gods to whom they sell themselves. This will be a Law to them for all their people forever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then say to them, ‘Any man of the house of Israel, or visiting from another land, who gives a burnt gift or other gift,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and does not bring it to the door of the meeting tent to give it to the Lord, will be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If any man of the house of Israel, or visiting from another land, eats any blood, I will turn against that person who eats blood, and he will not be among God’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the life of the flesh is in the blood. I have given it to you on the altar to make your souls free from sin. For the blood makes you free from sin because of the life in it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I have said to the people of Israel, ‘None of you should eat blood. And the man who visits you from another land should not eat blood.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man from the people of Israel, or from other people living among them, catches an animal or bird which may be eaten, he should pour out its blood and cover it with dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For blood is the life of every living thing. So I said to the people of Israel, ‘Do not eat the blood of any living thing. For the life of every living thing is its blood. Whoever eats it will be cut off.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every person, both living in the land or one who has come from another land, who eats an animal that dies or is killed by wild animals, must wash his clothes and wash himself in water. He will be unclean until evening. Then he will be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not wash them or wash his body, he will suffer for his own sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not do what is done in the land of Egypt where you lived. And do not do what is done in the land of Canaan where I am bringing you. Do not follow their laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to do what I say and keep My Laws and live by them. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So keep My Laws and do what I say. If a man obeys them, My Laws will be life for him. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You should not go near a person of your own family to have sex. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not put your father to shame by taking the clothes off your mother. She is your mother. Do not take her clothes off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your father’s wife. Her body is for your father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your sister, the daughter of your father or of your mother, if she is born at home or away from home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter. For they are of your own family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your father’s wife’s daughter, born to your father. She is your sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your father’s sister. She is of your father’s own family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your mother’s sister. She is of your mother’s own family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not put your father’s brother to shame. Do not go near to take the clothes off his wife. She is of your family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your daughter-in-law. She is your son’s wife. Do not take her clothes off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your brother’s wife. Her body is for your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off a woman and her daughter. And do not take the clothes off her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter. They are of her own family. It is sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While your wife is still living do not marry her sister making her as important to you. Do not take off her sister’s clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And you are not to go near a woman to take off her clothes during the time when she has a flow of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not have sex with your neighbor’s wife. You would be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not give any of your children as a gift on an altar to the false god Molech. Do not put the name of your God to shame. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie with a man as one lies with a woman. It is a sinful thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not have sex with any animal, or you will be unclean. And no woman should give herself to an animal to lie with it. It is a sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not allow yourself to sin in any of these ways. For by doing all these things the nations that I am driving out in front of you became unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the land is unclean. So I have punished its sin. The land has spit out its people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, you are to keep My Laws and do what I have decided. Do not do any of these sinful things, not you or the man who lives among you from another land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the men who have lived in the land before you have done all of these sinful things. The land is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do none of these things or the land will spit you out when you make it sinful, as it has spit out the nation that was before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does any of these sinful things will be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do what I say. Do not do any of these sinful things that were done before you. Do not make yourselves sin by doing them. I am the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to all the people of Israel, ‘Be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one of you must have respect for his mother and his father. And keep My Days of Rest. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not turn to false gods or make gods for yourselves. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When you give the Lord a peace gift, give it so you will be pleasing Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be eaten the same day you give it, and the next day. But what is left until the third day will be burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is eaten at all on the third day, it is a sin. It will not be received.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one who eats it will carry his guilt. For he has made the holy thing of the Lord sinful. That person will not be among God’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When you pick the food of your land at gathering time, do not pick all the way to the corners of your field. And do not gather the food left on the ground there after you have picked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not gather what is left among your vines, or gather the grapes that have fallen. Leave them for those in need and for the stranger. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not steal. Be honest in what you do. Do not lie to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie when you make a promise in My name, and so put the name of your God to shame. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not make it hard for your neighbor or rob him. You should not keep the pay of a man who works for you until the next morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not say bad things against a man who cannot hear. Do not put something in the way of a man who cannot see. But fear your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Be fair in how you judge. Do not show favor to the poor or to the great. Be fair in how you judge your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go around saying things that hurt your people. Do not do things against the life of your neighbor. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘In your heart do not hate someone from your own country. You may speak sharp words to your neighbor, but do not sin because of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not hurt someone who has hurt you. Do not keep on hating the sons of your people, but love your neighbor as yourself. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Keep My Laws. Do not let your cattle have young by a different kind. Do not plant your field with two kinds of seed. Do not wear clothing made of two kinds of cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with a woman who is a servant, promised to another man, but has not been paid for or made free, they must be punished. But they will not be put to death, because she was not free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will bring his guilt gift to the Lord at the door of the meeting tent. A ram will be used for the guilt gift before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With it the religious leader will go through the worship of washing to take away the man’s sin, and he will be forgiven for the sin he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When you come into the land and plant all kinds of trees for food, think of their fruit as being something you should not touch. You should not touch it for three years. It must not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the fourth year all their fruit will be holy, a gift of praise to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifth year you may eat of their fruit, so they may give more food for you. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not eat anything with the blood in it. Do not tell the future or do witchcraft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not cut the hair on the side of your head or face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not make any cuts on your body for the dead. Do not burn any pictures that will stay on your body. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not put your daughter to shame by making her sell the use of her body. Or the land will become full of shame and sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep My Days of Rest and honor My holy place. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not ask what you should do from those who speak with bad spirits or talk to the dead. Do not find them or you will be unclean. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Show respect to the person with white hair. Honor an older person and you will honor your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If a stranger lives with you in your land, do not do wrong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You should act toward the stranger who lives among you as you would toward one born among you. Love him as you love yourself. For you were strangers in the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not lie about the weight or price of anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Always tell the truth about it. I am the Lord your God, Who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep all My Laws and do all that I tell you. I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘Any man of Israel or of the strangers living in Israel, who gives any of his children to the false god Molech, must be put to death. The people of the land will kill him with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I Myself will go against that man and he will not be numbered among God’s people, because he has given some of his children to Molech, making My holy place sinful and bringing shame on My holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the people of the land close their eyes when a man gives any of his children to Molech, and do not put him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I Myself will go against that man and his family. They will not be numbered among God’s people, and all who follow him to sell themselves to Molech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I will go against the person who turns to those who speak with bad spirits and talk to the dead. In doing this, he sells himself to them. He will not be numbered among God’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you should set yourselves apart and be holy. For I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep My Laws and live by them. I am the Lord Who sets you apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If there is anyone who curses his father or mother, he will for sure be put to death. Because he has cursed his father or mother, his blood will be on his own head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If a man does sex sins with another man’s wife, even his friend’s wife, both the sinful man and woman must be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with his father’s wife, he has put his father to shame. Both of the guilty ones must be put to death. They will suffer for their own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them must be put to death. They have done a bad sex sin. They will suffer for their own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with a male as if he were a woman, both of them have done a very sinful act. They must be put to death. They will suffer for their own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man marries a woman and her mother, it is sin. Both he and they will be burned with fire, so this kind of sin will not be among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with an animal, he must be put to death. Kill the animal also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman goes near any animal to have sex with it, you must kill the woman and the animal. They must be put to death. They will suffer for their own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If a man takes his sister, his father’s or mother’s daughter, and he sees her without clothes on and she sees him, it is a shame. They will be punished in front of their people. He has taken off his sister’s clothes. He will suffer for his own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with a woman who has a flow of blood, and takes her clothes off, he has made her flow to show. And she has shown the flow of her blood. So both of them will not be numbered among God’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not take the clothes off your mother’s sister or father’s sister. For that is putting to shame one of your own family. They will suffer for their own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with the wife of his father’s or mother’s brother, he has put to shame his father’s or mother’s brother. They will suffer for their own sin. They will die without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man takes his brother’s wife, it is sin. He has put his brother to shame. They will have no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Keep all My Laws and do what I tell you, so the land where I am bringing you to live will not spit you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not follow the ways of the nation which I am driving out before you. For they did all these things, and so I hated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have said to you, “Their land will belong to you. I Myself will give it to you for your own, a land flowing with milk and honey.” I am the Lord your God, Who has set you apart from all other peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to know the difference between the clean animal and the animal that is unclean, and between the clean bird and the bird that is unclean. Do not make yourselves a sinful people with animal or bird or anything that moves on the ground, which I have set apart from you as being unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be holy to Me, for I the Lord am holy. I have divided you from the nations, so you belong to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘A man or woman who speaks with bad spirits or who talks to the dead must be put to death. They will be killed with stones. They will suffer for their own sin.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Say to the religious leaders, the sons of Aaron, ‘No one should make himself unclean for a dead person among his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except for his own family, his mother, father, son, daughter and brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or his young sister who is near to him because she has had no husband. For her he may make himself unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He should not make himself unclean as a husband among his people, and so make himself sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They should not cut all the hair from any part on their heads, or cut part of the hair off their face, or make cuts in their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They should be holy to their God and not put the name of their God to shame. For they give the gifts by fire to the Lord, the bread of their God. So they must be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They should not take a woman who is unclean because of selling the use of her body. They should not take a woman who is divorced from her husband. For the religious leader is holy to his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you must set him apart, for he gives the bread of your God. He will be holy to you. For I, the Lord Who sets you apart, am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the daughter of any religious leader makes herself sinful by selling the use of her body, she puts her father to shame. She will be burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The head religious leader on whose head the holy oil has been poured, and who has been set apart to wear the clothing, must not take the covering off his head or tear his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must not go near any dead person or make himself unclean even for his father or mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must not go out of the holy place or sin against the holy place of his God. For the crown of the holy oil of his God is on him. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He should take a wife who has never had a man before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He should not marry a woman whose husband has died, or a divorced woman, or one who has made herself sinful by selling the use of her body. But he should marry a woman from his own people, who has never had a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By doing this he will not sin against his children among his people. For I am the Lord Who makes him holy.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to Aaron, ‘None of your children or their children who has something wrong with his body should go near to give the bread as a gift to his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one whose body is not perfect should come near, no blind man, or man who cannot walk, or one with a marked face, or a bad arm or leg,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a man who has a broken foot or hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a man with a crooked upper back from birth, or a very little man, or one who has a bad eye or skin trouble or sores, or one whose sex parts have been crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man among the children of Aaron the religious leader, who has something wrong with his body, should come near to give the Lord’s gifts by fire. He should not come near to give the bread of his God, because he has something wrong with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy and of the holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he should not come near the curtain or the altar, because he has something wrong with him, and so he may not sin against My holy places. For I am the Lord Who makes them holy.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses spoke to Aaron and to his sons and to all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Aaron and his sons to be careful with the holy gifts that the people of Israel set apart for Me. So they will not sin against My holy name. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘If any one of all your children comes near the holy gifts that the people of Israel set apart for the Lord, while he is unclean, he will be cut off from My holy place. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the children of Aaron who has a bad skin disease or something flowing from his body may eat of the holy gifts until he is clean. If one touches anything that is unclean because of a dead body, or has had his seed come from his sex part,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or touches anything that is unclean that moves on the ground, or touches any man who makes him unclean, for whatever reason,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the man who touches any such thing will be unclean until evening. He must not eat of the holy gifts unless he has washed his body in water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun has gone down, he will be clean. After that he may eat of the holy gifts, for they are his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He should not eat an animal that dies of itself or is killed by wild animals. He will be unclean if he does. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders must obey My Law, so they will not be sinful because of it and die because they sin against My Law. I am the Lord Who makes them holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But no one who is not a religious leader may eat the holy gift. One who is visiting the religious leader or working for him must not eat of the holy gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a person whom the religious leader buys to work for him with his own money may eat of it. And those who are born in his house may eat of his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a religious leader’s daughter is married to a man who is not a religious leader, she must not eat of the holy gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a religious leader’s daughter loses her husband by death or divorce, and has no child and returns to her father’s house as when she was young, she may eat of her father’s food. But no stranger may eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man eats a holy gift by mistake, he must add a fifth of its worth to it and give the holy gift to the religious leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders must not make the holy gifts unclean that the people of Israel give to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This would bring sin upon them when they eat their holy gifts. For I am the Lord Who makes them holy.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to Aaron and to his sons and to all the people of Israel, ‘When any man of the house of Israel or of the strangers in Israel gives his gift for a burnt gift to the Lord, to pay a promise or as a free-will gift
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to please the Lord, it must be a male that is perfect from the cattle, sheep or goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not give anything that is not perfect, for you will not please the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man gives a peace gift to the Lord to keep a special promise or for a free-will gift from the cattle or the flock, it must be perfect to be received. It must have nothing wrong with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not give to the Lord or make a gift by fire on the altar to the Lord any animals that are blind or broken or hurt or have a flowing sore or a skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may give for a free-will gift a bull or lamb which has some part too long or too short. But it will not be received if it is to pay a promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not give to the Lord any animal with its sex parts hurt or crushed or torn or cut. Do not give such animals on the altar in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not receive such animals from a man from another land to give as the food of your God. For they are unclean. They are not perfect. They will not be received from you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a bull or sheep or goat is born, it must stay seven days with its mother. After that it will be received as a gift by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But do not kill a cow or female sheep and her young on the same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you give thanks to the Lord by giving a gift in worship, give it the right way so you will be received.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be eaten on the same day. Do not leave any of it until morning. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So keep My Laws and obey them. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not sin against My holy name. I will be honored among the people of Israel. I am the Lord Who makes you holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘These are the special suppers of the Lord, which you will keep for holy meetings. These are My special suppers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Work may be done for six days. But the seventh day is the Day of Rest, a holy meeting when you do no work at all. It is the Day of Rest to the Lord in all your homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘These are the special suppers of the Lord, the holy meetings you will keep at the right times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourteenth day of the first month in the evening begins the Lord’s religious gathering to remember how His people left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifteenth day of the same month is the Lord’s special supper of bread without yeast. For seven days you will eat bread made without yeast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day you will have a holy meeting. You will not do any hard work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will give a gift by fire to the Lord for seven days. On the seventh day is a holy meeting. You will not do any hard work.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘When you come into the land I am going to give you and gather its grain, bring some of the first fruits of your grain to the religious leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will wave the grain before the Lord for you to be received. The religious leader will wave it on the day after the Day of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day when you wave the grain, you will give a perfect, one year old male lamb as a burnt gift to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grain gift with it will be one-fifth part of a basket of fine flour mixed with oil. It is a gift by fire to the Lord for a pleasing smell. And the drink gift with it will be a jar of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not eat bread or dry grain or new grain until this same day, when you have brought the gift to your God. It is to be a Law forever for all your people in all your homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Number seven full weeks from the day after the Day of Rest, from the day when you give the grain for the wave gift. There will be seven whole Days of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Number fifty days to the day after the seventh Day of Rest. Then give a new grain gift to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring from your homes two loaves of bread for a wave gift, made of one-fifth part of a basket of fine flour. They will be made with yeast, as first-fruits to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the bread give seven one year old male lambs that are perfect, and one young bull, and two rams. They will be a burnt gift to the Lord, with their grain gift and their drink gift. It is a gift by fire with a pleasing smell to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then give one male goat for a sin gift and two male lambs one year old for a peace gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leader will wave them with the bread of the first-fruits as a wave gift before the Lord, with the two lambs. They will be holy to the Lord for the religious leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On this same day call together a holy meeting. Do no hard work. It is a Law forever in all your homes for all your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When you gather the food of your land, do not pick all the way to the corners of your field. And do not gather the food that falls. Leave it for those in need and the stranger. I am the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘On the first day of the seventh month, you will have a Day of Rest. It will be a day of remembering, made known by the blowing of horns, a holy meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not do any hard work. But give a gift by fire to the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The tenth day of this seventh month is the day to be made free from sin. It will be a holy meeting for you. You will be without pride and give a gift by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do no work on this day. For it is a day to be made free from sin, to be made free from your sin before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is any person who will not be free from his pride on this day, he will be kept away from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does any work on this day, I will destroy from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do no work at all. It is a Law forever for all your people in all your homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be a Day of Rest for you. And you must be without pride. You will keep your Day of Rest from evening until evening on the ninth day of the month.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘On the fifteenth day of this seventh month is the special supper of tents to the Lord. It will last seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A holy meeting will be on the first day. Do no hard work of any kind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give a gift by fire to the Lord for seven days. On the eighth day have a holy meeting and give a gift by fire to the Lord. It is a special gathering. Do no hard work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘These are the special suppers, the holy meetings you will keep at the right times. They will be for giving to the Lord gifts by fire, burnt gifts and grain gifts, gifts of animals and drink gifts, each on its own day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are to be added to the Days of Rest of the Lord, and your gifts, both those that are promised and your free-will gifts that you give to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered the food of your land, you will have the special supper of the Lord for seven days. The first day and the eighth day will be Days of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day, you will take the leaves of beautiful trees, branches of trees with big leaves and of trees beside the river. And be full of joy before the Lord your God for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will keep it as a special supper to the Lord seven days in the year. It will be a Law forever for all your people. You will have it in the seventh month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will live in tents for seven days. All who were born in Israel will live in tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all your people to come may know that I had the people of Israel live in tents when I brought them out of the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses made known to the people of Israel the special suppers of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the people of Israel to bring you pure oil from beaten olives for the light to keep a lamp burning all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Outside the curtain of the Law in the meeting tent, Aaron will keep it burning from evening to morning before the Lord always. It will be a Law forever for all your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take care of the lamps on the pure gold lamp-stand before the Lord all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then take fine flour and bake twelve loaves of bread. Use two jars of flour for each loaf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set them side by side in two rows, six in each row, on the pure gold table before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put pure, sweet-smelling spices on each row to go with the bread as something to be remembered. It is a gift by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every Day of Rest he will set it before the Lord all the time. It is a Law forever for the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bread is for Aaron and his sons who will eat it in a holy place. It is a most holy part for him out of the gifts by fire to the Lord. It is his share forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the son of an Israelite woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went among the people of Israel. And the Israelite woman’s son and a man of Israel fought with each other among the tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of the Israelite woman swore against the name of the Lord. So they brought him to Moses. (His mother’s name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the family of Dan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they kept him shut up until the will of the Lord might be made known to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the one who has sworn against Me away from the tents. Let all who heard him lay their hands on his head. Then let all the people kill him by throwing stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to the people of Israel, ‘If anyone swears against his God, he will suffer for his own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who speaks against the name of the Lord will be put to death for sure. All the people will kill him with stones. Both the stranger and those born in the land will be put to death when he speaks against the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If a man takes the life of any human being, he will be put to death for sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who takes the life of an animal will pay for it, a life for a life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man hurts his neighbor, it will be done to him just as he has done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: broken bone for broken bone, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. Just as he has hurt a man, so he will be hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the one who kills an animal will pay for it with an animal. But the one who kills a man will be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have the same Law for the stranger and for the one born among you. For I am the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spoke to the people of Israel. And they took the one who swore against God and brought him away from the tents and killed him with stones. So the people of Israel did as the Lord told Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses at Mount Sinai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘When you come to the land I will give you, then the land will have a Year of Rest to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six years you will plant seeds in your field. Six years you will take care of your vines and gather their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the seventh year will be a Year of Rest for the land, a Year of Rest to the Lord. You will not plant seeds in your field or take care of your vines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will not gather what grows of itself in your field. And do not gather the fruit of the vines that have not been cared for. The land will have a Year of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the Year of Rest the land will give food for you, for your men and women servants, the man you pay to work for you, and the stranger who lives with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even your cattle and the animals in your land will have food to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You are to number seven Years of Rest for yourself, seven times seven years. The time of the seven Years of Rest will be forty-nine years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let the horn be heard on the tenth day of the seventh month. On the day to be made free from sin you will let a horn be heard all through your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will honor the fiftieth year as holy. And let it be known in all the land that all who are living there are free. It will be a happy time for you. Each of you will return to what is his. Each will return to his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That fiftieth year will be a happy time for you. You will not plant seeds in the field, or gather the food that grows of itself, or gather fruit from the vines that are not cared for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a happy time. It will be holy to you. You will eat from what the field gives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘In this Year of Jubilee each one will have what was his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you sell anything to your neighbor, or buy from your neighbor, do not do wrong to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will pay your neighbor by the number of years since the Year of Jubilee. And he will sell to you by the number of years the food may be gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will make the price more if there are many years, and make the price less if there are few years. For he is selling you the food that is gathered each year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not do wrong to one another, but fear your God. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘So keep My Laws and do what I say, and you will be safe living in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the land will give its food, so you can eat all you want and be safe living there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you say, “What will we eat in the seventh year if we do not plant seeds or gather in the food of our field?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will let My good come upon you in the sixth year, so it will give you enough food for three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you are planting seeds in the eighth year, you can still eat from the old store of food. You can eat the old food until the food of the ninth year is gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The land will not be sold to be kept forever. For the land is Mine. You are only strangers staying with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the land you have, you must be willing to let it go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your brother becomes poor and sells some of his land, then one in his family who is near to him is to come and buy what his brother has sold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a man may have no one to buy his land, and he himself may become able to buy it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he should add up the years since he sold it, and pay what is left of the price to the man to whom he sold it. So he will return to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he is not able to buy it again for himself, then what he has sold will belong to the one who bought it until the Year of Jubilee. In the Year of Jubilee it will be let go and he may return to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If a man sells a house within the walls of a city, he has the right to buy it back for a whole year from the time he sold it. He can buy it during that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is not bought back again for him within a whole year, then the house within the city walls belongs forever to the family of the one who bought it. It will not be returned to him in the Year of Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But houses in towns that have no walls will be thought of as open fields. They may be let go, and will be returned in the Year of Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The houses in the cities of the Levites may be returned to the Levites at any time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a house is not bought again by a Levite, then the house that was sold in one of their cities will be returned to him in the Year of Jubilee. For the houses of the Levites belong to them among the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the open field of their cities must not be sold. It belongs to them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If your brother becomes poor and is not able to pay you what he owes, then you should help him as you would help a stranger or visitor. So he may live with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not make him pay for the use of the money he owes you. But fear your God, so your brother may live with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not make him pay for the use of your money or your food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, Who brought you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If your brother becomes so poor that he sells himself to you, do not make him work as a servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be as a man who is paid to work for you, as one who is traveling from place to place, until the Year of Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will leave you, he and his children, that he may return to the land of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I brought them out of the land of Egypt as My servants. They are not to be sold as a servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not make it hard for him, but fear your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those men and women you may have who are sold as servants will be from the nations around you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may buy from among the children of the strangers who live among you, and from their families that are with you and were born in your land. You may own them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may give them to your children after you, to receive as their own. You can have them as servants forever. But do not make it hard for your brothers, the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Now a stranger or one visiting you may become rich. And your brother may become so poor that he sells himself to a stranger living among you, or to the children of a stranger’s family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he may be made free after he has been sold. One of his brothers may pay the price to free him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father’s brother, the son of his father’s brother, or one of his own family may pay the price to free him. Or if he becomes rich he may pay the price himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the one who bought him he will add the years from the year he sold himself until the Year of Jubilee. The price for him to be set free will be decided upon by the number of years. The time he was with the man who owned him will be as that of a man paid to work for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there are still many years, he will return a part of the price which was given for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is only a few years until the Year of Jubilee, he will decide upon the amount of money with his owner. He should pay the price to be set free, decided upon by the number of years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be like a man paid to work for him year by year. Make sure his owner does not make it hard for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if the price is not paid for him in this way, he will go free in the Year of Jubilee, he and his children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the people of Israel are My servants. They are My servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not make gods for yourselves. Do not set up for yourselves something to look like a god or a holy object. Do not set up something cut from stone in your land to bow down to. For I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep My Days of Rest and honor My holy place. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you live by My Laws and do what I say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you rain at the right time. So the land will give its food and the trees will give their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crushing of your grain will last until the grapes are gathered. The grape gathering will last until the seeds are planted. You will eat your food until you are full, and be safe living in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give peace in the land. You will lie down and no one will make you afraid. I will make the land free from the danger of wild animals. And no sword will move through your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will go after those who hate you, and they will fall in front of you by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of you will go after a hundred. A hundred of you will go after ten thousand. And those who hate you will fall in front of you by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will care for you and give you many children. I will keep My agreement with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat last year’s food, and use it all because you will have new.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make My home among you. My soul will not turn away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will walk among you and be your God. And you will be My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God Who brought you out of the land of Egypt so you would not be their servants. I have broken loose the heavy load from your back and made you walk straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But if you do not obey Me and do not do all I say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you turn away from My Laws and do not want to do what I tell you to do, and do not do it, and so break My agreement,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will do this to you: I will bring upon you much fear, disease that destroys, and sickness that will waste away the eyes and make the body weak. You will plant your seeds for nothing, for those who hate you will eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will turn against you so you will fall in front of those who fight you. Those who hate you will rule over you. You will run away when no one is coming after you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If after all of these things you still do not obey Me, I will punish you seven times more for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will break the pride you have of your power. I will make your sky like iron and your earth like brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will use your strength for nothing. For your land will not give food, and the trees of the land will not give fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If you act against Me and will not obey Me, I will bring you seven times more trouble than your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will let the wild animals loose among you. They will rob you of your children and destroy your cattle. They will make you few in number, so that your roads will be empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If after these things you do not turn to Me, but still go against Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will go against you. I Myself will punish you seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring a sword upon you that will punish you for breaking the agreement. I will send disease among you when you gather together in your cities. So you will be given into the hands of those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I take away your bread of life, ten women will make your bread in one stove. They will give out your bread by weight. And you will eat it and not be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If you still do not obey Me after all this, but go against Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will go against you with anger. I Myself will punish you seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat the flesh of your sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will destroy your high places and cut down your altars of special perfume. I will throw your dead bodies on what is left of your gods. My soul will hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will destroy your cities also, and your holy places. I will not smell your pleasing smells.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will destroy the land, so those living in it who hate you will be filled with fear because of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will divide you among the nations and send the sword after you. Your land will be destroyed and your cities a waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then the land will be like new because of its Days of Rest while it lies waste and you are in the land of those who hate you. Then the land will rest and have new life because of the Days of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as it lies waste it will have the rest it did not have on your Days of Rest, while you were living in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of those of you who are left in the lands of those who hate you, I will make their hearts weak. The sound of a leaf blown by the wind will make them run away even when no one is going after them. They will run away as if it were a sword, and they will fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fall over each other as if running from the sword, when no one is going after them. You will have no strength to stand up in front of those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will die among the nations. The land of those who hate you will eat you up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those of you who are left will waste away in the lands of those who hate you, because of their sins. Also because of the sins of their fathers, they will waste away with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If they tell their sins and the sins of their fathers which they did when they were not faithful to Me and were against Me with anger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (I also was angry with them and brought them into the land of those who hate them) if their sinful heart loses its pride and they are willing to turn away from their sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will remember My agreement with Jacob, My agreement with Isaac, and My agreement with Abraham. And I will remember the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the land will be left behind them and become better with its Days of Rest while it lies empty without them. During this time they will turn away from their sin because they had not done what I told them to do and their soul hated My Laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet even when they are in the land of those who hate them, I will not turn away from them. I will not hate them enough to destroy them and break My agreement with them. For I am the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because of them I will remember the agreement with their fathers, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt in the eyes of the nations, to be their God. I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the Laws which the Lord made between Himself and the people of Israel through Moses at Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the sons of Israel, ‘When a man makes a special promise, you will decide upon the worth of this person for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The price you put on a man from twenty to sixty years old will be fifty pieces of silver, by the weight of the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a woman it will be thirty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a male from five to twenty years old it will be twenty pieces of silver. For a woman it will be ten pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your price for a child from one month to five years old will be five pieces of silver for the boy, and three pieces of silver for the girl.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your price for a person sixty years old and older will be fifteen pieces of silver for the man, and ten pieces of silver for the woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the person is too poor to pay your price, he will be brought to the religious leader. The religious leader will decide the worth of the person by how much he who made the promise is able to pay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If it is a kind of animal which men give as a gift to the Lord, any such animal that is given to the Lord will be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must not have another animal take its place, good for bad or bad for good. If he does trade one animal for another, then both animals will become holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the animal is unclean and not the kind which men give to the Lord, then he will bring the animal to the religious leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leader will decide if it is good or bad. Whatever price the religious leader puts on it, so it will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the man wants to buy it again, he will add a fifth to your price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When a man sets apart his house as holy to the Lord, the religious leader will decide if it is good or bad. Whatever price the religious leader puts on it, so it will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the man who sets it apart wants to buy his house again, he will add one-fifth part to your price. Then it will be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If a man sets apart to the Lord part of a field he owns, you will decide upon its price by the seed needed for it. Ten baskets of barley seed will be worth fifty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he sets apart his field during the Year of Jubilee, it will be worth your full price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he sets apart his field after the Year of Jubilee, the religious leader will decide upon its worth by the years left until the next Year of Jubilee. It will be taken off your price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the man who sets it apart wants to buy his field again, he will add one-fifth part to your price. Then it will be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not want to buy the field again, or has sold the field to another man, it cannot be bought again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the field becomes free in the Jubilee, it will be holy to the Lord, like a field set apart. It will belong to the religious leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man sets apart to the Lord a field he has bought, which is not a part of the land he was given by his father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the religious leader will decide its worth until the Year of Jubilee. The man will pay that amount on that day as holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Year of Jubilee the field will return from him who bought it to the one who owned it first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The price of silver used in the holy place will decide its worth. One piece of silver will be worth twenty small pieces of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But no man may set apart a first-born of the animals. A first-born of the cattle or the flock belongs to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is an animal that is unclean, he will buy it again by paying your price and one-fifth part added to it. If it is not bought again, then it will be sold for your price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But nothing that a man sets apart to the Lord of all he has, of man or animal or his own land, will be sold or bought. Everything that has been set apart is most holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No person who has been set apart to be destroyed from among men can be paid for. He must be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The tenth part of all the land, of the seed of the land or of the fruit of the tree, is the Lord’s. It is holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man wants to buy any of the tenth part that belongs to the Lord, he will add one-fifth part to its price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every tenth animal of the cattle or flock, whatever passes under the shepherd’s stick, the tenth one will be holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man will not ask if it is good or bad, or trade it for something else. If he does trade it for something else, then both will become holy. He cannot buy them again.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the Laws the Lord gave Moses on Mount Sinai for the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
